title: Fabrice Bellard Releases MicroQuickJS
author: Aissen
aiHeadline: Fabrice Bellard, the guy who invented the world's smallest Linux distro, is back with MicroQuickJSâ€”a JavaScript engine so tiny it might just fit inside a squirrel's brain.

title: Meta is using the Linux scheduler designed for Valve's Steam Deck on its servers
author: yellow_lead
aiHeadline: Meta, in a desperate attempt to make their servers less laggy, has decided to steal the Linux scheduler from Valve's Steam Deck. Because clearly, gaming consoles know how to manage server load better than Facebook engineers.

title: Instant database clones with PostgreSQL 18
author: radimm
aiHeadline: PostgreSQL 18 just dropped, and it's like they gave database cloning a superpower upgrade. Now you can clone your database instantly, because who needs time when you can have instant gratification?

title: Ask HN: What are the best engineering blogs with real-world depth?
author: nishilpatel
aiHeadline: Ask HN: What are the best engineering blogs with real-world depth? Because clearly, no one has figured this out yet, and we're all still pretending to know what we're doing.

title: We replaced H.264 streaming with JPEG screenshots (and it worked better)
author: quesobob
aiHeadline: In a shocking twist, a company replaced H.264 streaming with JPEG screenshots and somehow it worked better. Because apparently, the future of video streaming is 15-year-old tech and pixelated images.
